column4: anyone know why my motherboard would only be using half of it's available RAM?
has anyone ever experienced this?
bad ram?
i'm sort of doubting it
it's brand new from circuit city, and my other (original RAM) is having the same behavior
is it a linux-only problem? does windows recognize it?
no it's a bios level problem
i've got two identical 1G chips, brand new from circuit city, BIOS reports 1G of total ram
so does top
1) update bios, 2) double check bios settings, 3) return
i originally bought a single 1G chip from them
there's some sort of reset option on most bios's...try it?
of the other brand of RAM they have. it also registered as half size
that's why i took it back
ok i'll try resetting/flashing my BIOS
it's a lower tier mobo, BioStar K8NHA Grand
was a good deal from newegg.com iirc
any solution yet?
i flashed my bios and everything is all good :)
yay for 2G of RAM!
i did have to buy a new floppy drive to do so :(
but my old one was white, my case is black, and this floppy is black too... so now my case matches finally! :)
